content: this is dmg and we're going to do strong wooden dungeon goes
so strong wooden dungeon doors and this is the original simple wooden dungeon
door that we did and this is going to be a variation of that so we're going to
need the lollipop sticks the tongue depressors the toilet roll and now we're
going to have some double layer cardboard so I'm just measuring the
width of those sticks and I'm measuring 5 centimeters by the width of the sticks
so the four sticks they're measuring 5 centimeters and then I'll just cut it
out with a craft knife and this will be the filler for the door and just keep
that cardboard aside so now we're going to measure a strip which is going to be
the width of this cardboard so it's usually about seven millimeters I'm just
going to use the cardboard to measure and that strip is 16 centimeters long
and go a little bit longer if you want it just in case but 16 centimeters cut
that out and then have a look at dmg 0:07
to find out how to make these two sides of the door because that's exactly how
we made the simple wooden door and so now I've got two strips of card I've got
the base and I've got the two sides of the door and now we're going to apply
hot glue to the one side of the double-sided cardboard and stick that on
the back of the one door and then hot glue on the other side and stick the
other board down so it now looks like a chocolate ice-cream sandwich mmm
ice-cream sandwich okay so we're cleaning up the edges so that
everything's aligned do some hot glue down the side on the corrugated
cardboard and then get the strip of cardboard cardstock and stick it on the
one side and then hot glue down the other side and then bend it over and
stick it down so that just forms the middle bits of the door and then I'm
going to hot glue the underside of the door
and stick that to the base base also show you how to make that in video 7 so
there we have the door so far and now we're going to put the banding on so
this is what the second strip of cardstock is for so just apply the
banding so apply the hot glue at the top where the curve starts and just above
the bottom so probably about 1/2 cent and then 1/2 is about a centimeter away
from the bottom cut off the excess cardboard and do the same on the other
side top and bottom and then we're going to continue on and do the middle bits as
well so you'll have three sets of banding on each side so this is going to
be representing metal banding and we'll just show you how we paint that up just
now so they were just putting in a center piece and the door will this is
basically a metal banded strong wooden door they've got the two little metal
rings again if you have a look at video 7 and all should talk about those gold
metal rings again make sure it's on the correct side and not on the wrong side
so that you don't have miss matching rings on opposite sides of the door so
very simple just blobs a hot glue stick in the Rings and just clean off the
excess wisps or have one of your trusty friends clean it off for you he often
gets wisps all over himself now I've black the spray painted those
black bonded most people would say and I'm now just applying brown acrylic
paint just over the banding as well it doesn't matter if I can do it we're
going to paint over that so just boots of speed to finish it off and just go
over the whole area with the brown and then we're going to add a little bit of
yellow so I'm just mixing that on the cards up there on the cardboard just a
light dusting of yellow and probably need a little bit more than that
let's go boots of speed a little bit more remembered will always dry darker
than what you see it here and then I'm just applying some mixture
of black and white to make gray onto the banding and also onto the base and over
the edges as well so there's metal bands around the entire door holding
everything in place and on the back as well so the reason I don't use a brush
for this because that sort of streaky look that's done by the by the sponge is
what gives it the sort of metal look and then I just paint the Rings white if
you've got silver you can use silver but because I'm using a simple painting with
a simple color scheme I'll just leave it at white and now I'm just painting on
some rivets with white paint very simple very easy and I'll just boot speed to
get that to the end and there you have it it's a strong wooden door so that's
how we make strong wooden dungeon doors if you like this video like button if
